Entries.default: "Belfetto. One to write home about."
Against a backdrop of jeering youths, a young woman raises her arms with an air of practiced drama. Before her, two men stand across from each other, mirroring scowls.
"You both attest that you have made all possible efforts to come to a peaceful..." The woman trails off as you approach, and you find yourself the sudden target of the crowd's attention.
"Bazzo! I'll gut you like a fish!"
"Are fish all you know, sailmaker?"
"Who is this nasenale? How many cousins do you have, Orso?" Larro chuckles.
"Postenago! Does that look like any cousin of mine?"
"We have business. What do you want?"
"How should I know? Your kin lie with eels."
"To know what's going on here, for starters."
"I'm here to fetch Larro. Nera is looking for him."
A few chuckles arise from the bystanders, and Larro's face flushes with embarrassment.
"The family keeps you on a tight leash, Larro. Will getting impaled on a Valera blade prove something to them?"
"This doesn't concern you. We've come to settle a challenge-" Before he can finish, Larro quickly speaks up.
"Tsst! Watch your words, oaf. You want the Huana to know we're dueling?"
"My bazzo to the tribals. We should be free to settle matters on Vailian terms." Orso glances in your direction with annoyance.
"I suppose you have a good reason for this duel?"
"Kill each other if you like. I'm not getting involved."
"I don't want any trouble."

"That wolf he calls 'Mother' would have us live out our days polishing Bardatto silver!" 

Orso spits at the ground between them.
"Is this slight worth one of your lives?"
"Stop this. The Royal Deadfire Company is doing well enough without its competitors killing each other."
"Fine. Do what you like, just get it over with."
"The Huana are gathering reinforcements to storm this position. They should be here any second."
"Merla! Scatter!" Larro whistles to his attendants, and they break apart in a disorganized exodus from the scene.
"What? Where are you going, you stuffed shirt, I - hey, wait!" Orso and his comrades scramble to follow suit.
The pair of duelists eye each other warily.
"I was the one who suggested fisticuffs, but you were eager to cut me open."
"Ac. This is but one chapter in a long anthology of Bardatto arrogance."
"I did not send for anyone to preside over our contest."
"You don't have to do this, you know."
"If you want a civilized resolution, you're talking to the wrong fop."
"To first blood, then! Shall we resume?"
"If you can't stand the sight of blood, then you have no business telling us our business." Larro spits with disdain.
"Fìnoma. I am ready to cross swords if you are, Larro."
"Gellarde! Shall we resume?"
"Merla... he's dead." Larro wipes fresh blood from the back of his shaking hands.
"These things do usually end with someone dying."
"You had better go - the guards will not care that you weren't involved."
"It gets easier after the first time, you know."
[Say nothing.]

"Not bragging or laughing any more, are you, Larro?"

Orso looks down at his bloody work. An uncertain expression crosses his face.
"These things do usually end with someone dying."
[Say nothing.]
"What's done is done. I will take shelter in the estate until this calms down."
"Augh!" Orso reels back, clutching at a shallow gouge across his cheek.
"Vidòrio! Another scar for your collection." Larro steps back with a final flourish of his sword.
"Arrrgh!" Larro falls to his knees, clutching at his face.
"Not so pretty anymore, postenago?" Orso wears an accomplished grin.
"Witness, you have a friends in the Valera household if you want them." Nodding, Orso signals to leave.
"I'm a Watcher. Do you have any idea what I can do to you?"
"Shut up and shake hands before I hurl you both over this waterfall."

"This street thug called my family a warren of corrupt inbreds! But is there a dungheap in all the world that does not have a little Valera cousin scratching through it?"

 Larro opens his arms wide and smiles to the milling crowd.
"Ten copper pieces on Larro."
A round of cheers accompanies your declaration. The Bardatto second accepts your wager, and Orso scowls in your direction.
"Ten copper pieces on Orso."
"What? This is an honorable duel, not some... pit fight!" In spite of Larro's protest, the Valera second accepts your bet with a wink.
"Speak to my mother, Ezzali, if you happen to be by the estate. Our troubles will only worsen from here."
"No? You didn't hire a bodyguard, coward?"
"Ac. Our country benefits little from the flowers of its great families cutting each other down in their prime. First blood should satisfy your honor."
"Children of the Republics are soft from sleeping on beds of money."
"Anyone can kill. Fighting to first blood would be enough to prove who's the better man."
"Unless you want to go next, I suggest that you don't bring up Royal Deadfire business with a pair of angry Vailians."
"On that much we see eye to eye."
"Ac, but you're a witness now. You can at least watch us bleed each other dry."
"Does this have to be settled by death? Surely there are better alternatives."
"Nothing less than the total disgrace of the Valeras would satisfy me."
"Then you will die unfulfilled!" Orso shakes his head and huffs.
Larro and Orso trade uneasy glances, their vitriol for each other momentarily set aside.
"A threat? Di verus? We are the sons of the wealthiest families in Deadfire."
"Keep talking and I'll draw your soul into the great beyond."
[Say nothing.]
"Ekera, the queen consigns murderers to the Gullet." Tekēhu wags an admonishing finger at the pair.
"Atello, my father, may wish to meet you. We'll need friends to weather this feud."
"Speak to my mother, Ezzali, if you happen to be by the estate. Our troubles will only worsen from here."
"At least that's one less Bardatto for us to worry about." Orso frowns and signals his attendant to leave.
"Come, we will toast to vidòrio at the estate. Orso, try to remember your place next time." He signals his attendant to leave.
"Just make sure the other Bardattos learn from your example." Orso nods and signals for his attendant to depart.
"I can't help but wonder if Nera was right, and our troubles are only beginning." Thoughtful, he signals his attendant to depart, sparing you only a glance.
"Larro, go find your sister so she knows you're alive."
"Ac, of course. I let Orso's poisonous insults waylay me again."
"Larro, go find your sister so she knows you're alive."
"Congratulations on a nearly bloodless victory."
[Say nothing.]
"Ac, of course. I let Orso's poisonous insults waylay me again."
"Congratulations on a nearly bloodless victory."
"Larro, go find your sister so she knows you're alive."
[Say nothing.]
"It gets easier after the first time, you know."
Orso glares at Larro and bites back whatever insult he had at the ready.
"Business? Please. I know a formal challenge when I see one."
"Arrogance? Per complancanet, you should thank me for my patience."
"If I wanted the opinion of some tentacle-headed savage..." Larro grimaces at Tekēhu with a mixture of distaste and curiosity.
"At least we don't sleep on rocks, temorina."
"This isn't over, you coward! You can't hide behind your corrupt mother forever!" Orso leaves the arena in a hurry.
"Would your families approve of this?"
"Ac, my brother Martino would applaud if he knew."
"My sister would not approve in the slightest, but this is my duty all the same." Larro tips up his chin with an imperious smile.
"Larro, what say you?"
"We are civil enough to kill each other without making an incident out of it."
"Death rarely solves problems. It just creates new ones."
"Who invited the philosopher?"
"Small wonder the old empire collapsed in civil strife if this is the Vailian way." He sneers.
"And how do your colonies fare, Aedyran?" Orso narrows his eyes at Aloth.
"Must you encourage this barbarism?" He frowns his disappointment at you.
"Must you encourage this barbarism?" He frowns his disappointment at you.
"Tch. Not I."
"This does not end here, Valera dog." Larro wipes away a line of blood and casts it to the ground.
"Enjoy this moment, Bardatto. I will see your satisfaction turn to ashes."
"You are not fit to spill blood on Queen's Berth." Grimacing, Larro turns from Orso to you.
"Only if done properly."
"Now who's being naive?" Maia folds her arms and smirks.
One of the duelists reflexively holds his hand over his heart and bows to Pallegina.
"Eccosi, fair knight, if our appearance offends."

"Save your breath. I am a sworn brother of the Canc Suolias, neither available for nor interested in your wooing."

She gives Larro an annoyed sneer.
"Postenago, he doesn't know when to stop flirting." Orso turns his gaze toward you.
"Easier still when it becomes instinct."
"Eccosi, lest I forget your winnings for the wager." He signals his second to pass you a pouch of coins.
"Get this man his gambling winnings." He nods and someone tosses you a pouch.
Entries.female: "Get this woman her gambling winnings." He nods and someone tosses you a pouch.
